elements.title: O Ewigkeit, du Donnerwort
elements.contents: ... that "O Ewigkeit, du Donnerwort", translated as "Eternity! tremendous Word", is a hymn by Johann Rist (pictured) that served as the basis for the first work in Bach's chorale cantata cycle?

elements.title: Oman at the 2016 Summer Olympics
elements.contents: ... that Barakat Al-Harthi missed his layover and lost some of his sports equipment before competing for Oman at the 2016 Summer Olympics?

elements.title: Meatballs
elements.contents: ... that although the Pat Buchanan campaign commercial Meatballs was created by a Houston-based ad agency, it was not initially aired in Houston, lest its message turn off voters?

elements.title: mass incidents
elements.contents: ... that income inequality in China is considered to be a major cause of mass incidents?

elements.title: the first formula in European mathematics to represent an infinite process
elements.contents: ... that in 1593, French amateur mathematician François Viète found the first formula in European mathematics to represent an infinite process, a product of square roots that he used to compute π?

elements.title: Marita Camacho Quirós
elements.contents: ... that Marita Camacho Quirós, who was First Lady of Costa Rica (1962–1966), is the oldest former first lady in the world and a supercentenarian?

elements.title: Dead Blondes and Bad Mothers
elements.contents: ... that in Dead Blondes and Bad Mothers, Jude Ellison Doyle proposes that Frankenstein is about maternal fear that the author Mary Shelley experienced after family tragedies?

elements.title: Duffy Lewis
elements.contents: ... that Duffy Lewis was the only major league player to pinch hit for Babe Ruth?
